text: @raunakdoesdev @helicone_ai This is like an LLM learning to sleep when it gets tired. 😴 if it learns to compare new experiences to pretrained experiences and store them with references, it would be huge.

parent.text:
I just built an infinite memory system for LLM chats: Remembrall.

Add a UID to your OpenAI call and I'll manage inserting past chat history into the context window with < 100ms latency.

2 lines of code to integrate. @helicone_ai style monitoring for free. DM for beta access. https://t.co/KteJxWApww

text: Very interesting would be fun to tinker with and implement in the right use cases.

text: @raunakdoesdev @jockeyclarke @helicone_ai man, this is clever. Nice job

parent.text: @jockeyclarke @helicone_ai yep that's right, but doing an intermediate llm call to handle that compression and using vector db for retrieval of only relevant info at run time

text:
@raunakdoesdev @helicone_ai I don’t care what the nitpickers say. This looks really slick and right along the lines of some experiments I wanted to try out. This is effectively compressing the chat history so it fits into the context window, yes?
And you re-compress the history as it becomes less relevant?

text: @raunakdoesdev @SamuelsonTweets @helicone_ai With an LLM constantly performing CRUD operations on the vector database, the database can become an infinite cache for conversation history.

parent.text: @SamuelsonTweets @helicone_ai not quite - there's an intermediate processing step that goes from conversation history -> relevant context before storing the vector embeddings
